text:
Hello I'm Katie Pix and today I'm showing
you how to make homemade tortilla chips great

for the party season for sharing with all
your friends and a nifty way to use up leftover

tortilla wraps, shop bought tortilla chips
are usually deep fried and heavily seasoned

homemade takes control of the level of salt
and saturated fats in your savoury snacks,

pre-heat the oven to 200 degrees C, 180 for
fan assisted, or gas mark 6, brush both sides

of your tortilla wraps with olive oil cut
into triangles with scissors or a knife you'll

get six decent sized chips from just one tortilla
arrange in a single layer on a baking tray

if you want to avoid washing up like me use
baking parchment bake in the oven for 7-8

minutes, be sure to check on them making sure
they're going lovely and golden brown try

not to burn them once cooled add a topping
of your choice I've gone for sea salt and

balsamic glaze oh yeah, click the link for
more ideas and there you have it as simple

as, now if you do have any leftovers be sure
to bag them up quickly to avoid them going

stale don't forget to subscribe for more tips
and tricks in just 1 minute flat- bye!
